    CV

    Education

    • Ph.D in Biostatistics, University of Southern California, 2025 (expected)
    • M.S. in Biostatistics, Columbia University, 2020
    • B.S. in Genetics & Genomics, University of California, Davis, 2018

    Work experience

    Biostatistics Intern, BeiGene, 06/23

    • Developed R shiny web to guide triple outcome (Go/No-Go/Consider) decision making in basket trial design for oncology/hemotology phase Ib efficacy expansion studies.
    • Evaluated frequentist and Bayesian hierarchical modeling approaches in type I error and power for making the correct decision by simulations in R.
    • Supervisor: co-mentored by Nicole Li, Zang Miao, Huan Cheng

    Skills

    • Programming: R, Python, Linux, high performance computing, Git & Github
    • Other skills: scientific writing, presentation, communication, collaboration
    • Courses: Machine learning, Advanced statistical computing, High dimensional data, Data analysis, Clinical trial, Generalized linear models, Mixed effects modeling, Deep learning

    Publications

    • Inferring causal cell types of human diseases and risk variants from candidate regulatory elements

      Kim, A., Zhang, Z., Legros, C., Lu, Z., de Smith, A., Moore, J.E., Mancuso, N., and Gazal, S. (2024). Inferring causal cell types of human diseases and risk variants from candidate regulatory elements. medRxiv.

    • A scalable approach to characterize pleiotropy across thousands of human diseases and complex traits using GWAS summary statistics

      Zhang, Z., Jung, J., Kim, A., Suboc, N., Gazal, S., and Mancuso, N. (2023). A scalable approach to characterize pleiotropy across thousands of human diseases and complex traits using GWAS summary statistics. Am. J. Hum. Genet. 110, 1863–1874.

    Talks

    • Scalable count-based models improve power and robustness to detect eQTLs in large-scale single-cell data

    • A variational Bayesian approach to characterize pleiotropic components across thousands of human diseases and complex traits using GWAS summary statistics
